name: Newtonian Gravitation
summary: A classical theory describing gravity as an attractive force between masses, inversely proportional to the square of the distance.
status: superseded in extremes by General Relativity; still useful at low speeds/weak fields

name: General Relativity
summary: Einstein's geometric theory of gravitation where mass-energy curves spacetime and free-falling objects follow geodesics.
status: well-tested; breaks down near singularities / not unified with quantum mechanics

name: String Theory
summary: Proposes that fundamental particles are one-dimensional strings; aims to unify quantum mechanics and gravity.

name: Miasma Theory of Disease
summary: Disease was thought to be caused by 'bad air' (miasma). Replaced by germ theory.

name: Germ Theory of Disease
summary: Microorganisms are the cause of many diseases; led to antisepsis, vaccination, and antibiotics.

name: Simulation Hypothesis
summary: The idea that reality could be an artificial simulation (e.g., computer simulation).

name: Hogwarts Magic Theory
summary: Within the Harry Potter universe, magic is a manipulable force governed by wands, incantations, and intent.

name: Flat Earth Theory
summary: Claims Earth is flat; conflicts with observational evidence (satellites, circumnavigation, photos, physics).
